title: Argument-Based Instructional Design to Strengthen Mathematical Reasoning and Proof Processes in Gifted Students

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Focuses on analyzing gifted students' mathematical thinking processes and acquiring structured teaching methods for pre-service and in-service teachers

learning_goals: Develop the ability to analyze mathematical proof processes by applying the six elements of Toulmin’s argumentation model: claim, grounds, warrant, rebuttal, qualifier, and backing.
Design strategies to transition from informal reasoning to formal proof using digital tools like GeoGebra.
Develop an integrated instructional approach combining multiple representations (visual, algebraic, linguistic) to support gifted learners’ understanding of abstract concepts.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
